Grouped_Utterances: Right. I still have some tough days, but I’m trying to manage them better. A few times, yeah. Sometimes I catch myself spiraling into negative thoughts.
Yeah, I noticed the flowers blooming in the neighborhood. It reminded me of springtime with my uncle.

Honestly, I felt more relaxed afterward. It’s nice to clear my head a bit.  It was a little awkward at first, but I started writing about my memories with him, and it felt nice to get it out. I think so. I feel like I’m not bottling things up as much. I feel a little more centered and less anxious.

Hey, Ellie. I’ve been trying to stick to the walks we talked about. I managed to go for a walk three times last week. It felt good to get outside. Yeah, it feels good. I also tried journaling a bit. I see my couch, a picture frame, the TV, a window, and my coffee table. I can touch my chair, my phone, my shirt, and the blanket on my lap. I can hear the clock ticking, some birds outside, and the hum of the fridge. I smell coffee and a hint of my laundry detergent. I can taste the coffee in my mouth.
One technique is the “5-4-3-2-1” exercise. It involves naming five things you can see, four things you can touch, three things you can hear, two things you can smell, and one thing you can taste.
I’d like to keep walking and maybe try a new healthy recipe for dinner. That sounds like a great plan! How about we aim for two walks and one new recipe this week? I can do that!
